title: Samsung management and Union reach settlement on wage issues, after Labour Minister holds talks
content: An amicable settlement was reached between the parties on issues relating to wage hikes; as per the agreement, workers will get an overall wage hike of ₹18,000 from April 1, 2025 to March 31, 2028

title: Hike in licence fee: Bengaluru wine merchants not to lift stock for two days from Tuesday
content: Retailers at the State level could also decide to join them to protest a steep hike by the week end.

title: Home Minister launches new OCI portal
content: New portal to provide enhanced functionality, advanced security, and a user-friendly experience for more than 5 million OCI cardholders and new users

title: Congress govt. completes two years with bouquets and brickbats
content: Siddaramaiah hopes to break the record of being the longest-serving Chief Minister of Karnataka, held by D. Devaraj Urs

title: More awareness needed on genetic blood disorders: A.P. Health Minister
content: While there are 1,900 people suffering from hemophilia, people affected with thalassemia and sickle cell anemia number around 2,100 each in the State, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: TTD Trust Board member demands vigilance probe into ‘Tulabharam scam’ in Tirumala during YSRCP government
content: Bhanuprakash Reddy says the amount offered by the devotees towards ‘Tulabharam’ had not reached the TTD exchequer during 2019-2024

title: Tiranga rally held at Kondapi to celebrate Operation Sindoor success
content: Development works worth more than ₹50 crore completed in Kondapi, proposals worth ₹450 crore sent for setting up a drinking water scheme from Ramatheertham to the constituency, says Minister Dr. Dola Sree Bala Veeranjaneya Swamy

title: Mock drill conducted to educate VMC staff about safety measures to prevent fire accidents
content: Fire personnel demonstrate how to respond to a fire alarm, evacuate the building, and manage smoke-filled areas during the drill

title: Pakistan’s drone and missile attacks targeting the Golden Temple in Amritsar were thwarted: Indian Army
content: Pakistan attempted to target the Golden Temple on the intervening night of May 7-8; India’s air defence system, including indigenous Akash missiles and L-70 air defence guns, intercepted the Pakistani drones and missiles

title: Allegations against officials part of attempts to derail investigation, alleges ED
content: Aneesh Babu has alleged that some persons had demanded money for settling a case booked against him under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The Vigilance has arrested Wilson Varghese, Mukesh Kumar from Rajasthan, and Kochi-based chartered accountant Renjith Warrier in this connection

title: Keep a close watch on suspected terrorist activities in Andhra Pradesh in the wake of Operation Sindoor, Pawan Kalyan tells Chief Secretary and DGP
content: He stresses the need for special surveillance along the coastal areas and on the likely presence of Rohingyas, terrorist sympathisers and sleeper cells

title: Special Task Force constituted to probe into liquor deaths in Jangareddygudem in 2022
content: 20 persons, including a couple of women, reportedly died due to consumption of liquor contaminated with methyl alcohol in March 2022, in Jangareddygudem and the neighbouring areas

title: Schools in Poonch, the worst-hit in military confrontation, reopen to only 16% attendance
content: The area saw over 14 civilian deaths and injuries to dozens in the recent Pakistan shelling; parents still feel insecure

title: COVID-19 cases see a surge in Singapore, Hong Kong; India reports 257 cases — all mild: Health Ministry
content: The statement comes following a recent review meeting of experts from National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC), Emergency Medical Relief (EMR) division, Disaster Management Cell, Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and Central government hospitals

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister to conduct surprise inspections after June 12 to get feedback on implementation of welfare schemes
content: Emphasis should be laid on ensuring cent per cent public satisfaction as the coalition government is completing one year soon, says Naidu at a review meeting

title: Improve sanitation in Kurnool city: Minister Bharath
content: Minister says, “If there is no improvement in sanitation, the staff and officials concerned will be held responsible, and action will be taken against them.”

title: Surankote temple attack: Chargesheet filed against two, including one based in Pakistan
content: Two accused named, including a Pakistan-based Hizbul Mujahideen operative; SIA alleges cross-border conspiracy to incite communal unrest in J&K

title: Chief Minister is ‘outsourcing Punjab’s governance to Delhi bosses’, says State BJP chief
content: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar leads delegation to Punjab Governor; demands ED inquiry into alleged liquor mafia nexus, terms incident a ‘preventable tragedy’

title: Colourful procession marks BJP’s Tiranga Yatra in Bagalkot
content: The saffron party organised the rally to celebrate the success of Operation Sindoor against terror camps in Pakistan

title: Traffic hit as portion of under-construction elevated NH-66 caves in at Kooriyad
content: The elevated highway portion across the paddy fields of Kooriyad caved in and damaged three cars moving along the service road about 30 ft down. Passengers ran for cover leaving their cars behind as boulders and debris came crashing down from the height. Six of them suffered minor injuries

title: CID makes two more arrests in ₹95 crore GBR Crypto scam
content: The two accused are said to have played active roles in the conspiracy and also received proceeds from the crime

title: Work at KC Circle in Hubballi to be completed by the end of August
content: Deputy Commissioner Divya Prabhu G.R.J. gives the assurance to residents after reviewing the work on the flyover

title: Five held after Kanpur police bust extortion gang led by traffic SI, home guard, female PRD jawan
content: Kanpur police arrest gang posing as STF, extorting money; mastermind absconding, targeted illegal activities, busted with recovered items

title: Wooden electrical panel blamed for Gulzar Houz fire in Hyderabad that killed 17 persons
content: An array of political leaders have been making rounds at the incident spot,  stressing on the need for regular fire audits in shops and warehouses

title: Hire unemployed youth instead of ex-servicemen, Mehbooba urges Omar
content: The ‘mounting crisis of unemployment afflicting youth in J&K’ must not be overlooked, the PDP chief said, in response to the J&K government’s plan to hire 4,000 ex-servicemen to safeguard installations

title: Beyline Das granted bail under stringent conditions
content: The advocate has been barred from entering the Vanchiyoor police station limits for a period of two months or until the filing of the chargesheet, whichever is earlier.

title: CM Adityanath condemns SP’s online remarks, urges review of party’s social media conduct
content: FIR filed after BJP protests in Lucknow; SP chief Akhilesh Yadav responds with call for mutual restraint

title: 900 spots in A.P. identified as unsafe for women: DGP
content: As many as 169 accused have been convicted by the courts in cases related to crime against women and children in the last ten months, says Harish Kumar Gupta

title: Controlled burning ensures food security for Nilgiri tahrs in Eravikulam
content: Controlled burning of grasslands helps sustain fresh grass in the hills and ensures ample food for the wild animals. The process also offers a solution to human-animal conflicts

title: Bellad says police yet to take action on movement of suspected foreign nationals in twin cities
content: There has been a sudden rise in the purchase of SIM cards between May 2 and 10 in the twin cities, says Deputy Leader of Opposition in the Assembly

title: J.K. Dobbins to the Commanders? Jalen Ramsey to the Rams? Best fits for free agents, trade candidates
content: Some unsigned free agents are still looking for new teams, while there are often trades before training camps start in July. Given that, let's find fits for 14 available players.

title: Scheffler: Used new driver at PGA after failed test
content: Rory McIlroy's driver wasn't the only one the USGA deemed nonconforming in testing ahead of this week's PGA Championship. Scottie Scheffler confirmed Sunday after his five-stroke victory that he also was forced to use a new driver for the tournament.

title: Source: Ex-Jets GM Douglas returns to Eagles
content: Former Jets general manager Joe Douglas is returning to the Eagles in a senior scouting role, a league source confirmed.

title: Newgarden, Power sent to rear of Indy 500 grid
content: Two-time defending Indianapolis 500 winner Josef Newgarden and Team Penske teammate Will Power will have to start from the final two spots on the grid Sunday after their teams were penalized for violating the rules during qualifying weekend.

title: Messi urges Miami to be 'united' in 'difficult' time
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi urged the team to stay strong and remain united after losing 3-0 to in-state rival Orlando City SC at Chase Stadium on Sunday night.

title: Rahm after PGA collapse: 'Tough pill to swallow'
content: After being tied for the PGA Championship lead with nine holes to play, Jon Rahm came up seven shots short of winner Scottie Scheffler on Sunday.

title: Liberty eliminates No. 1 Aggies to win regional
content: Liberty beat No. 1 Texas A&M 6-5 on Sunday night to win the Bryan-College Station Regional and eliminate the top-seeded Aggies.

title: WNBA probes 'hateful' comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA is looking into allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed at Angel Reese after an incident involving Caitlin Clark and Reese in Saturday's Sky-Fever game.

title: OKC conquers nerves to roll Nuggets, reach WCF
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder rolled into the Western Conference finals after beating the Nuggets 125-93 in Game 7 on Sunday.

title: 🏀 NBA playoff MVPs: Brunson? SGA? Jokic?
content: Our playoff MVP update features a Game 7 savior, two Wolves and a superstar that hasn't played in three weeks.

title: Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft after the combine
content: The draft could get interesting at No. 3. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: 8 things we learned from the WNBA's opening weekend
content: The Mystics might be better than projected. The Fever defense is better, period. Here's what we learned as the WNBA season opened.

title: Who wins the Eastern Conference finals? Early look at keys to Hurricanes-Panthers
content: It's a rematch of the 2023 edition. Can Carolina win this time, or will Florida head back to the Cup Final?

title: 'Ueck was always first': How Christian Yelich is carrying on Bob Uecker's legacy with Brewers
content: Whether he's starring or slumping, Christian Yelich has taken the torch as the face of the franchise in Milwaukee.

title: Navy SEALs, John Legend and lobster mac & cheese: Inside an NFL rookie's first month
content: Rookies including Tyler Warren, Josh Conerly Jr. and Nick Martin share insight on their first days as an NFL player.

title: Scottie Scheffler is still on top of the golf world
content: Jon Rahm made it close for a while on Sunday, but Scheffler's inevitability hung in the Charlotte air all day until he eventually pulled away to win the Wanamaker Trophy.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: MLS: Miami sliding as Philly reeling in Caps
content: Inter Miami have lost five of its past seven, losing touch with the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Angel City's King: Medical team 'saved my life'
content: Angel City defender Savy King was released from the hospital Saturday, just more than a week after she collapsed on the field during a match.

title: Arteta challenges board to back him with signings
content: Mikel Arteta has challenged the Arsenal hierarchy to "do what they have to do" in the summer transfer market to turn the club into Premier League champions.

title: Conte sees red as Napoli cling to first in Serie A
content: Napoli's hopes of securing the Serie A title on Sunday had to be put on ice after they were held to a 0-0 draw at Parma.

title: Galaxy still winless after Tráfico draw with LAFC
content: Marco Reus scored twice, including the game-tying free kick in the 87th minute as the LA Galaxy earned a 2-2 tie with rival LAFC on Sunday night in Carson, California.

title: Ajax boss emotional after historic title collapse
content: Ajax manager Francesco Farioli has said he has no regrets despite his side finishing as runners-up in the Eredivisie in one of the biggest title collapses in history.

title: Flick 'fine' as Barça lose 1st in LaLiga since Dec.
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick was happy to write off his team's first league defeat since December as the newly crowned LaLiga champions lost 3-2 at home to Villarreal on Sunday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo Jr. nets 1st Portugal U15s goals
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, scored his first two goals for Portugal's U15 side in Sunday's 3-2 victory against Croatia.

title: Crystal Palace's FA Cup joy, two-team Serie A title race goes to wire, more
content: Crystal Palace shocked Man City to win the FA Cup, Barcelona celebrated their LaLiga success and Serie A's title race is going down to the final day between Napoli and Inter: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder the big favorites to win championship
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP heading into the conference finals.

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Red Bull has taken a step forward, which means Max Verstappen's win at Imola might be a sign of things to come.

title: Waiver wire: NL Central southpaws lead top picks
content: Eric Karabell outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United closing on Matheus Cunha
content: Manchester United are closing in on the signing of Wolves forward Matheus Cunha. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Conflict with Pak was always conventional, no nuclear signaling': Govt to Parl panel
content: The Ministry of External Affairs clarified to a parliamentary committee that the India-Pakistan ceasefire was a bilateral decision, refuting Donald Trump's claims of US mediation. During the meeting, officials confirmed the conflict remained conventional, with no nuclear signaling from Pakistan. India successfully struck Pakistani air bases, regardless of the platforms used.

title: 'Pahalgam probe revealed terrorists communicated with masterminds in Pak'
content: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri briefed a parliamentary panel on the Pahalgam attack investigation, revealing that terrorists communicated with masterminds in Pakistan. He highlighted the presence of UN-designated terrorists freely operating in Pakistan and inciting violence against India, further emphasizing a nexus between terrorists, the Pakistani military intelligence, and civilian administration. The conflict remained conventional, with a truce established bilaterally.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Viral video: Goenka storms out of balcony after Pant dismissal vs SRH
content: Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka's frustration was evident after Rishabh Pant's early dismissal against Sunrisers Hyderabad in a crucial IPL 2025 match. Pant's poor form continued as he managed only 7 runs, adding pressure to LSG's playoff hopes. Goenka's reaction, captured in a viral video, highlighted the high stakes and tension surrounding the team's performance.

title: 'Trading like hawala business': SC seeks clarity from Centre on Bitcoin regulation
content: The Supreme Court has voiced concerns over the Centre's delay in formulating cryptocurrency regulations, highlighting potential economic risks and drawing parallels to illegal "hawala" operations. Justices questioned the lack of a clear policy, emphasizing the need for oversight to monitor the parallel under-market.

title: US Embassy in India issues warning of permanent ban on traveling : If you ...
content: The US Embassy in India has issued a warning about the consequences of overstaying visas. In a message on Twitter, the American embassy in India has warned Indian citizens traveling to the U.S. of Permanent Ban if they over stay their visa. The warning is applicable to all visa holders -- Work, Student as well as Tourist. The warning says if they remain in the US beyond their authorized stay, they will not only face deportation but also a Permanent Ban.

title: India proactively monitors Covid situation amid scare in Singapore, Hong Kong
content: India's Covid-19 situation is currently under control, with only 257 active cases reported as of May 19, 2025, and almost all cases are mild. Health authorities are closely monitoring the surge in cases in Hong Kong and Singapore. The Union health ministry remains alert, continuously assessing the situation, and has instructed hospitals to monitor influenza-like illnesses.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people who…"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: Mhatre vs Suryavanshi: Battle of teens in match between wooden spooners
content: Two rising stars — Ayush Mhatre and Vaibhav Suryavanshi — are set to clash in a battle that could shape the next generation of Indian cricket and the Indian Premier League (IPL). Chennai Super Kings will take on Rajasthan Royals at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in a contest that holds no bearing.

title: YouTuber, students and smugglers in North India’s Pakistan-linked espionage network
content: Indian authorities have launched a major crackdown on a Pakistan-linked espionage network, arresting at least 12 individuals across northern states. The suspects, including a YouTuber and an influencer, are accused of relaying sensitive military information to Pakistani intelligence officers. Investigations are ongoing, focusing on digital devices, financial transactions, and potential links to drug smuggling.

title: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra was in touch with Pak handlers during blackouts
content: Security agencies arrested YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and three others for allegedly spying for Pakistan, maintaining contact with handlers even during recent blackouts in north India. Malhotra, along with Nauman Elahi, Devender Singh Dhillon, and Arman, are accused of sharing sensitive information about vital installations. Authorities are investigating Malhotra's role in shaping narratives and Arman's connection to Pakistani intelligence operatives.

title: Why China has asked officials to cut spending on alcohol, cigarettes & travel
content: China is enforcing fiscal prudence by instructing officials to cut spending on non-essential items like travel and receptions, reflecting President Xi Jinping's focus on austerity amid economic challenges and local debt concerns.

title: CSK head coach breaks silence on MS Dhoni's IPL future, says...
content: Stephen Fleming remained tight-lipped about MS Dhoni's future as CSK faces a rebuilding phase after a disappointing season. Youngster Ayush Mhatre's emergence provides a silver lining, while other young talents get a chance to shine. Rajasthan Royals, plagued by poor auction decisions and chasing woes, also look to end their season on a positive note.

title: After 'joker' remark, Kohli-Rahul row takes surprising turn as ...
content: The public feud between Rahul Vaidya and Virat Kohli seems to be resolving as Kohli unblocked Vaidya on Instagram. This follows Vaidya's initial criticism of Kohli's social media activity and subsequent blocking. Vaidya has now expressed gratitude and praised Kohli, signaling a potential end to their digital conflict after heated exchanges and online backlash from fans.

title: 'After getting out ... ': 14-yo Suryavanshi on 'crying' after IPL debut dismissal
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the young Rajasthan Royals batter, addresses rumours about him crying during his debut. He explains it was due to eye irritation from bright lights. Suryavanshi has impressed everyone with his fearless batting. He scored 195 runs in six matches. Despite Rajasthan Royals' struggles, his emergence is a positive sign. Fans are excited to see his future performance.

title: 'Dhamaka humne kiya': How Indian Army dealt with Pakistani shelling
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian Army responded strongly to Pakistani shelling in Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in significant damage to terror infrastructure and no Indian casualties. Indian army officials confirmed that the operation was a calculated strike aimed at destroying enemy terror sites and posts aiding infiltration.

title: 'India not a dharmshala ': SC rejects Sri Lankan Tamil’s plea seeking refuge
content: The Supreme Court rejected a Sri Lankan national's plea to settle in India after serving a seven-year sentence under UAPA for LTTE links, stating India, burdened with a large population, cannot be a 'dharamshala' for foreign nationals.

title: Hollywood is back with a bang! All eyes on 'Housefull 5'
content: After a period of box office struggles, Hindi cinema saw a resurgence with films like 'Jaat' and 'Kesari 2'. However, 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' has revitalized Hollywood's presence in India, achieving the highest opening day for a Hollywood release in 2025.

title: Does Biden's cancer admission prove MAGA was right about his health?
content: The arc of his life—marked by personal tragedy, quiet perseverance, and a five-decade career in public service—was the kind of political story that lent itself to grace in the end. A young senator elected at 29, a grieving father who took the oath beside his sons’ hospital beds, a seasoned legislator who steered landmark legislation across the aisle, a vice-president who stood loyally beside Barack Obama. And finally, a president elected to steady the ship after a rupture that nearly tore America apart.

title: KL Rahul set to be considered for Bangladesh T20Is
content: KL Rahul is eyeing a T20I comeback for India with Bangladesh tour the next opportunity. His recent IPL form has strengthened his case with eye on the 2026 T20 World Cup. Most recently, KL Rahul's Champions Trophy and IPL performances have highlighted his versatility. On Sunday, he scored a century in the IPL and became the fastest Indian to 8,000 T20 runs.

title: 'Opposing Modi shouldn't lead to ...': Rahul’s jet query draws Shivraj’s ire
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's questions about Indian jets shot down by Pakistan after Operation Sindoor, Shivraj Singh Chauhan urged prioritizing the nation over party politics. BJP spokesperson CR Kesavan accused Gandhi of echoing Pakistani propaganda and distrusting the armed forces. Gandhi questioned Jaishankar's remarks on informing Pakistan before strikes, prompting MEA clarification about the timing of the warning.

title: Ex-BJP MP Uday Singh named 1st national prez of Prashant Kishor's party
content: Jan Suraaj Party, founded by Prashant Kishor, appointed former BJP MP Uday Singh as its first national president on Monday. This decision comes as the party gears up for its first electoral contest in the upcoming Bihar polls later this year. Kishor had previously stated he would not hold any official position within the party.

title: 'Nation in shame': SC raps MP minister for remarks on Col Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court rebuked Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his derogatory remarks against an Army officer, deeming his apology insufficient and a national embarrassment.

title: Baba Vanga's predictions '25: Truth behind global catastrophe predictions
content: Baba Vanga's 2025 predictions, including economic collapse, war, and natural disasters, are being re-examined amidst current global instability. Her forecasts of economic turmoil, mind-to-mind communication, and devastating earthquakes are gaining renewed attention. Past predictions like 9/11 add weight to her ominous warnings about future conflicts and extraterrestrial contact, leaving the world in suspense.

title: While Travis Kelce attends Vegas event, Taylor Swift’s team shares this message
content: Taylor Nation commemorated the anniversary of Taylor Swift's 2022 NYU commencement speech, sharing inspiring quotes and reminding fans of her constant support. The post evoked emotional responses, with fans expressing gratitude for Swift's presence in their lives. Despite Swift's break, Taylor Nation ensures the connection with fans remains strong through a nostalgic post.

title: $1k for newborns and tax cuts: What is in Trump's 'one big beautiful bill'
content: Donald Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill Act" narrowly advanced through the Budget Committee, aiming for a full House vote before Memorial Day. The bill encompasses tax relief, immigration enforcement, entitlement reform, and defense spending. It proposes tax cuts, border wall construction, Medicaid work requirements, 'MAGA' accounts for newborns, and defense spending increases, while overhauling student loan programs.

title: Yusuf Pathan opts out of all-party delegation; TMC calls it 'unilateral decision'
content: TMC MP Yusuf Pathan withdrew from the all-party delegation after the Centre's "unilateral" selection, sparking criticism from TMC leaders Mamata Banerjee and Abhishek Banerjee, who emphasized the party's right to choose its representative. Congress also questioned the Centre's selection process, deeming it "dishonest" after its suggested names were rejected.

title: Cong takes 'sindoor ka sauda' swipe at PM, brings up Trump’s mediation claim
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticised the government for allegedly informing Pakistan before strikes on terror infrastructures, questioning the potential security risks. He also attacked PM Modi over Donald Trump's claim of brokering a ceasefire, alleging a secret deal. Rahul Gandhi has also questioned Jaishankar on the same issue, while MEA has refuted the Congress's claims, calling them a misrepresentation of facts.

title: Vi shares sink nearly 9% after Supreme Court rejects AGR relief plea
content: Vodafone Idea's shares plummeted after the Supreme Court dismissed telecom companies' petitions for adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues relief, wiping out a significant portion of Vi's market capitalization. The court rejected appeals from Vodafone Idea, Bharti Airtel, and Tata Teleservices, deeming them "misconceived," reinforcing the government's stance on recovering dues.

title: YT channel slammed for distorted India map, calls it 'non-issue'
content: Real Engineering's video about Isro faced criticism in India. The issue arose from an inaccurate map depicting India's borders. Indian viewers expressed outrage over the disrespect to the nation's territorial integrity. The channel's response and subsequent comments further fuelled the controversy. The incident highlights the importance of geopolitical sensitivity when discussing other countries.

title: 'Good for jobs and bills': UK and EU agree on landmark security and defence pact
content: Britain and the European Union have forged a new security and defence partnership, enabling closer collaboration amidst escalating global threats. The agreement allows the UK defence industry to participate in the EU’s €150 billion Security Action for Europe (SAFE) fund, potentially supporting thousands of British jobs.

title: Akshay Kumar & Vicky Kaushal ‘fight’ over ‘Op Sindoor’ film? Twinkle Khanna says...
content: Twinkle Khanna confronted Akshay Kumar about a supposed fight with Vicky Kaushal over a film called 'Operation Sindoor'. The rumour, which spread online, led to a brief argument. Akshay dismissed it as fake news. He was dealing with a minor injury from a fire scene on set. Both Akshay and Vicky are currently busy with their own film projects.

title: 'ISI activated them after Pahalgam attack': Police's big charge on Pak spies
content: Punjab Police arrested two Pakistani spies. They were in contact with Pakistan's ISI. The spies became active after the Pahalgam terror attack. Authorities transferred one lakh rupees to their accounts. Both individuals are from Gurdaspur and are around 19-20 years old. They are also involved in drug activities. They leaked secret information of security forces to Pakistan.

title: 'His mistake is his name': Cong slams 'BJP manufactured rage' on prof's arrest
content: The Congress party has accused the Modi government of double standards following the arrest of Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad for a social media post critical of violence. Congress leaders highlight the stringent charges against Mahmudabad, contrasting it with the lack of action against BJP ministers accused of demeaning the armed forces.

title: Bengaluru rain: BJP MLA uses JCB to navigate flooded streets
content: Bengaluru is grappling with severe flooding due to incessant rains, causing widespread disruption and drawing sharp political reactions. A BJP MLA's symbolic JCB ride highlights the crisis as the Deputy CM pledges action amidst criticism over preparedness. Residents express frustration as rescue operations continue and the IMD issues a yellow alert for continued rainfall.

title: BCCI secretary denies India has decided to pull out of ACC events
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia refuted reports claiming India's withdrawal from Asian Cricket Council tournaments to isolate Pakistan. Saikia clarified that the BCCI hasn't discussed or decided on participation in the Asia Cup or Women's Emerging Teams Asia Cup. He emphasized the board's current focus on the ongoing IPL and the upcoming England series.

title: Rahul questions Jaishankar's silence, asks how many aircraft did India lose?
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of external affairs minister S Jaishankar regarding Operation Sindoor, questioning the loss of Indian aircraft due to alleged prior warnings to Pakistan.

title: Pune Porsche crash: Adult or juvenile? One year on, no decision yet on teen driver
content: A year has passed since a 17-year-old's Porsche crash in Pune claimed the lives of two tech professionals, Ashwini Koshta and Anish Awadhia. The Juvenile Justice Board is yet to decide whether to try him as an adult, facing delays due to adjournments and quorum issues.

title: Woman’s body found in suitcase at UP home, husband held
content: In Shahjahanpur, a 31-year-old woman's body was discovered inside a suitcase at her residence, prompting a police investigation. Her husband, Ashok Kumar, has been detained for questioning. Ashok claims he found his wife hanging and, in a panic, placed her in the suitcase.

title: Sambhal mosque survey to continue as Allahabad HC rejects Muslim side's plea
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a petition seeking to halt proceedings in a land dispute between Jama Masjid and Harihar Mandir in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh. This ruling allows for the continuation of a court-ordered survey of the mosque premises, following claims that it stands on the site of a former Hindu temple.

title: Congress celebrating without any significant achievement, says BJP leader
content: Rajkumar Patil Telkur releases n Kalaburagi poster highlighting the Siddaramaiah-led Congress government’s failures

title: Centre sanctions ₹363.23 crore to improve drinking water supply in Guntur
content: Of the total funds, ₹331.10 crore will be utilised for the development of a dedicated pipeline to Gorantla area, while ₹32.13 crore has been earmarked to supply water to layouts situated downstream of Amrut water point, says Union Minister Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar

title: Imports hurting Himachal's apple industry, will write to PM on banning imports from Turkey: CM Sukhu
content: Himachal CM Sukhvinder Sukhu said he will urge the Centre to ban apple imports from Turkey, citing harm to local growers’ earnings

title: Meant to curb corruption, ED now caught up in it, says M.A. Baby
content: His statement comes as the Vigilance department intensifies its probe into bribery case involving ED officials from the Kochi unit

title: Heavy rain batters several parts of Tiruchi district
content: The downpour leaves behind a trail of destruction with several trees and electrical poles crashed; power supply was disrupted in many areas and roads were waterlogged

title: 100 vehicles seized, parents fined in crackdown on underage driving
content: The operation led to the seizure of 100 vehicles, including SUVs, and the imposition of fines amounting to ₹1.05 lakhs on parents and guardians

title: Central government continuing to privatise VSP through various means, say Left leaders
content: Leaders demand the State government to mount pressure on the Centre to give up its plan to privatise VSP, saying that it could be made a profit-making enterprise

title: Orthodox, Jacobite Churches face internal unrest over controversial remarks and leadership decisions
content: Discontent in Orthodox Church after Metropolitan of Adoor-Kadampanad diocese publicly described the Church leadership as ‘captors of parishes.’ Reappointment of Geevarghese Mar Coorilos as the Metropolitan of the Niranam diocese sparks disquiet in the Jacobite Church

title: Govt. hospital in Tiruchi to get PET scan centre soon
content: About ₹140 crore has been sought under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram  and staff for the scan centre, including medical and radiation oncologists, would be deputed from other institutions

title: "No Nuclear Signalling By Pak": Sources On What Parliament Panel Was Told
content: There was no 'nuclear signalling' by Islamabad during the military conflict with Pakistan earlier this month, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri told Parliament Monday evening.

title: Indian Tanks Operated From LoC During Op Sindoor, Took Out Pak Posts
content: T-72 tanks had rolled up to the Line of Control and took part in the May 7 Operation Sindoor that had destroyed terror bases in 9 locations in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, an officer of the Indian army has told NDTV in an exclusive intervi

title: Girl Falls Into Drain In Mumbai, Man Drowns While Trying To Rescue Her: Cops
content: An eight-year-old girl who fell into a drain in Mumbai was rescued by a 28-year-old man, who later drowned as he was stuck inside, police said.

title: 23 Get Life Term For Killing Woman On Suspicion Of Practising Witchcraft In Assam
content: A court in Assam's Charaideo district on Monday sentenced 23 people to life imprisonment on Monday for killing a woman on suspicion of practising witchcraft 13 years ago.

title: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra To Resume Through Nathu La Pass In Sikkim
content: The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, a religious pilgrimage undertaken by the Hindus to Mount Kailash and Mansarovar Lake in the Tibetan autonomous region of China, will resume through the Nathu La Pass in Sikkim.

title: US Announces Visa Curbs On Indian Travel Firms Behind "Illegal Migration"
content: The US said it is imposing visa restrictions on owners, executives, and senior officials of travel agencies in India for knowingly facilitating "illegal immigration" to the United States.

title: "Better Safe Than...": Court On Centre's Move Against Turkey-Based Firm
content: It is better to be safe than sorry, the Delhi high court remarked on Monday, as it heard a petition by Turkey-based company Celebi Airport Services India Pvt Ltd against the revocation of its security clearance.

title: Parliamentary Panel Unanimously Slams Trolling Of Foreign Secretary: Report
content: Parliament's Standing Committee on External Affairs unanimously condemned the trolling of Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and praised his professional conduct, sources said on Monday.

title: "I Am Also A Sufferer": Vice President After Chief Justice Flags Protocol Gap
content: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Monday echoed Chief Justice of India BR Gavai and said adherence to protocol was fundamental, as he lamented the absence of the vice-president's portrait next to those of the president and the prime minister.

title: "We Decide Who Goes": Trinamool Says Won't Send Diplomatic Outreach Nominees
content: Bengal Chief Minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee has said her party will skip the all-party international delegation on Operation Sindoor, since the Centre had not consulted her party.

title: India Logs 164 COVID-19 Cases In A Week, Kerala, Maharashtra Lead Tally
content: Maharashtra recently reported two deaths, which, according to doctors, are not COVID-19 deaths, but both patients were found to be COVID-19 positive.

title: Gary Lineker To Step Down From BBC After "Antisemitic" Social Media Post Row
content: Former England football captain Gary Lineker will leave the BBC at the end of the season, it was announced on Monday, days after he shared a social media post that contained antisemitic imagery.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump's Hollywood Tariffs Are A Blow To A Struggling Industry
content: Cinema has long been a tool of soft power for both the United States and China. However, despite its cultural value, filmmaking remains a business - and an expensive one at that. If profitability is compromised, the industry will inevitably retreat.

title: Former BJP MP Uday Singh Named First National President Of Jan Suraaj Party
content: Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor on Monday announced that former BJP MP Uday Singh has been unanimously chosen as its first national president.

title: Emergency Control Rooms, Rescue Camps: Tamil Nadu Prepares For Southwest Monsoon
content: As the Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) in Chennai predicted an increase in rainfall across the state, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has instructed to ensure the Emergency control room functions 24x7 and readiness of rescue vehicles.

title: China's BeiDou, A GPS Rival, Powers Over 1 Trillion Daily Location Checks
content: China's BeiDou satellite system is now powering billions of location checks daily and backing a growing chunk of the country's tech-driven economy, new data shows.

title: 'Misbehaviour' By Rocket Motor Failed ISRO's EOS-9 Satellite Launch. What Next
content: The 'misbehaviour' of the rocket motor may have contributed to the failure of the Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) workhorse rocket on its 63rd flight, experts suggest.

title: Britain Agrees To Trade, Defence Reset With EU
content: Britain agreed the most significant reset of defence and trade ties with the European Union since Brexit on Monday after US President Donald Trump's upending of the global order forced the two sides to move on from their acrimonious divorce.

title: How Hyderabad Building Turned Into Gas Chamber As Fire Raged
content: The death of 17 members of a family, including eight children, in a massive fire has left people shocked in Hyderabad.

title: "Silence Is Damning": Rahul Gandhi Targets S Jaishankar Again, BJP Replies
content: Doubling down on his attack on External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar, senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi today reiterated his earlier claim that the Centre informed Pakistan "at the start" of Operation Sindoor
